com.avaya.cmapi.callinformation

Interface CallInformationListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CallInformationAdapter

    public interface CallInformationListener
extends java.util.EventListener
    Allows applications to monitor the status of the call information link and be notified if the status changes. The call information link is one of the communication links between the Communication Manager and the Communication Manager API. The call information link must be operational in order to get detailed call information using the CallInformationServices.getCallInformation() method. Call information link status change events that can be monitored include:
    • when the call information link comes up
    • when the call information link goes down

    If you want your application to be notified of these events, provide a class that implements this interface and provide an implementation for each of the following methods. For those methods you do not wish to be notified of, just implement an empty body. Add your listener implementation using the CallInformationServices.addCallInformationListener() method.

    To stop being notified of the events, remove your listener implementation using the CallInformationServices.removeCallInformationListener() method.

    If multiple listeners are added, then each listener will be notified of events; the corresponding callback will be called on each listener that has been added.

    To learn more about using listeners, see Using Listeners.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.3 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void linkDown(LinkDownEvent downEvent)
      Called when the call information link becomes inoperational.
      void linkUp(LinkUpEvent upEvent)
      Called when the call information link becomes operational.

    • Method Detail

      • linkUp

        void linkUp(LinkUpEvent upEvent)
        Called when the call information link becomes operational. Occurs the first time the link is brought up, as well as every time the link is brought up after being down.

        Parameters:
        upEvent - indicates the name of the link

      • linkDown

        void linkDown(LinkDownEvent downEvent)
        Called when the call information link becomes inoperational. Occurs when it is determined that Communication Manager is not responding or Communication Manager and Communication Manager API are out of synch. Response will indicate which link is down and whether the connector server will attempt to reconnect automatically.

        Parameters:
        downEvent - information about the name of the link, and whether attempts will be made to reconnect automatically
